za.ac.wits.elen4010.fluidsim.mpiNodalCode

Class FakedIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • za.ac.wits.elen4010.fluidsim.mpiNodalCode.FakedIO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MpiIO

    public class FakedIO
extends java.lang.Object
implements MpiIO
    A class which implements MpiIO to inject "Fake" test data to the system for testing purposes
    See Also:
    MpiIO, TrueIO

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int commWorldSize
      Fake communicator size
      private int myRank
      Fake rank of the current process
      private java.lang.Object[] receivedData
      Data to be "received" when the mpiReceive command is called

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FakedIO(java.lang.Object[] data)
      Creates a new FakedIO class by accepting the data which will be "received" every time the mpi- Receive command is called along with the Status object

    • Constructor Detail

      • FakedIO

        public FakedIO(java.lang.Object[] data)
        Creates a new FakedIO class by accepting the data which will be "received" every time the mpi- Receive command is called along with the Status object
        Parameters:
        data - The fake data to be returned whenever the mpiReceive command is called
        status - The fake status to be returned whenever the mpiReceive command is called

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • mpiSend

        public void mpiSend(java.lang.Object[] data,
           int offset,
           int count,
           Datatype dataType,
           int destination,
           int tag)
        Implementation of the MpiIO mpiSend function which does nothing with the data being sent (NOTE: you could make it log the data to a file or something...?)
        Specified by:
        mpiSend in interface MpiIO
        Parameters:
        data - The data which will be sent over the network in the format of a buffer of the ite- ms to be sent
        offset - The off set from the start of the buffer to begin sending from
        count - The number of items (starting at offset) to send
        dataType - An indicator for the datatype which was sent (i.e. the type found in the buffer)
        destination - The rank which should receive the command
        tag - The tag which defines the user specified message type

      • mpiReceive

        public Status mpiReceive(java.lang.Object[] data,
                int offset,
                int count,
                Datatype dataType,
                int source,
                int tag)
        Implementation of the MpiIO mpiReceive function which return- s the "fake data" used to initialise the FakedIO object
        Specified by:
        mpiReceive in interface MpiIO
        Parameters:
        data - The data which will be sent over the network in the format of a buffer of the ite- ms to be sent
        offset - The off set from the start of the buffer to begin sending from
        count - The number of items (starting at offset) to send
        dataType - An indicator for the datatype which was sent (i.e. the type found in the buffer)
        source - The rank which sent the message
        tag - The tag which defines the user specified message type
        Returns:
        The status of the operation which contains important information such as the source a- nd tag fields
